STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 22, 2024
Kathleen Nikesch
WELLSPRING LUTHERAN SERVICES -LANSING
5826 Executive Dr,
Lansing, MI, 48911-5303
Re: License #: CB330371021
Dear Kathleen Nikesch:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
11/15/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified
by another agency the borrowing agency shall
have a record containing all the following:
• (a) Approval from the certifying agency
authorizing the placement of a child in the
home.
One of Three Borrowed Bed files reviewed did not have documentation of the
certifying agency authorizing the placement, prior to the placement, within the case
record.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim 11/03/2022, CAP Approved 11/11/2022
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified
by another agency the borrowing agency shall
have a record containing all the following:
• (b) Verification that the foster parent is
willing to accept the foster child.
2

One of Three Borrowed Bed files reviewed did not have documentation of the foster
parent's willingness to accept the placement, prior to the placement, within the case
record.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim 11/03/2022, CAP Approved 11/11/2022
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified
by another agency the borrowing agency shall
have a record containing all the following:
• (c) The initial evaluation and current
reevaluation.
One of Three Borrowed Bed files reviewed did not have documentation of the
borrowing agency's access to the initial and current reevaluations, prior to the
placement, within the case record.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim 11/03/2022, CAP Approved 11/11/2022
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified
by another agency the borrowing agency shall
have a record containing all the following:
• (d) A copy of all special evaluations
completed during the last 2 years.
One of Three Borrowed Bed files reviewed did not have documentation of the
borrowing agency's access to all special evaluations completed within the last 2
years, prior to the placement, within the case record.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim 11/03/2022, CAP Approved 11/11/2022
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified
by another agency the borrowing agency shall
have a record containing all the following:
3

• (e) Verification of all children currently
placed in the home.
One of Three Borrowed Bed files reviewed did not have documentation of the
borrowing agency's access to the record of all youth's placed in the home, prior to
the placement, within the case record.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim 11/03/2022, CAP Approved 11/11/2022
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial
removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
Two of Five open youth files reviewed (3FC & 2IL) contained updated service plans
not completed timely.
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
• (2) The agreement must be signed and dated by
the youth and the social service worker. The
agreement must be reviewed with the youth at
least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
Two of Two open files of youth in independent living placements reviewed did not
contain independent living agreements completed every 90 days.
CPA Rule 400.12511 Termination
• (2) An agency shall ensure and document that
each youth who ends independent living is
provided with all the following:
• (b) A birth certificate.
One of One closed files of youth previously living independently reviewed did not
contain documentation of the youth being provided a birth certificate at case closure.
4

CPA Rule 400.12511 Termination
• (2) An agency shall ensure and document that
each youth who ends independent living is
provided with all the following:
• (c) A social security card.
One of One closed files of youth previously living independently reviewed did not
contain documentation of the youth being provided a social security card at case
closure.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Timely entry of case contact should occur to accurately document face to
face visits and ensure they are documented in case service plans.
• CAPS for foster home violations must address the reason the non-
compliance occurred; rather than only address the action the foster parent took.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Be sure to respond to DCWL requests timely in response to rejected
renewal reports submitted to avoid the foster home license expiring.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one CAP in response to the 2023 licensing inspection
report dated 9/12/2023. The CAP was approved on 9/22/2023 and addressed one
violation related to MDHHS Policy 801-03, Medical Passports. The number of
violations has increased to nine this year, five of which were previously addressed
through a 2022 CAP and four of which have not been cited in the past two
inspections.
Chief Administrator Assessment
5

The chief administrator accurately identified concerns related to a high staff
turnover the past year resulting in areas of non-compliance which were not
present last year.
Financial Overview
A financial audit based on financial statements completed by a certified
accountant was reviewed. No financial concerns were noted.
Staff Interviews
The staff members interviewed reported satisfaction with their roles at the agency.
They described support and assistance from supervisors which helps them
accomplish their tasks.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency appears to have adequate space and equipment to provide for the
delivery of foster care, foster home licensing, and independent living services.
Physical CHRI and case records are stored securely in areas that prevent
unauthorized access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The DCWL Analyst identified one safety concern as follows:
Safety Alert: On 8/13/2024 it was observed a smoke detector was not located
between the sleeping areas and the rest of the home.
Resolution: On 9/16/2024 the agency Chief Administrator provided a photo of
an installed smoke detector between the sleeping areas and the rest of the
home.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
November 21, 2024
________________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 22, 2024
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
